709627f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue South, east side, and 76-70 Grove Street, at and south of the Sheridan Square subway station at West 4th Street. The subway entrance is in a little island which used to be the N.W. corner of Grove (formerly Burrows Street, originally Columbia Street) and West 4th (formerly Asylum Street) Streets. Sheridan Square (9.v.) is properly the triangular open space shown here in the left background, but it is loosely applied to both sides of Seventh Avenue South, from Christopher to Grove Streets, inclusive.
About 1928.
Ewing Galloway.
Neg. # 1052
709627f-a.folder: 7th Avenue South & Grove Street, Manhattan, NY

723184f.text:
Sheridan Square, east from Seventh Avenue South, showing part of the Shenandoah, or 10 Sheridan Square, an apartment building under construction on the site of 80, 82 Grove Street, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of Grove Street and Sheridan Square, north side
(Washington Place).
Probably 1928.
C. P. Cushing, Fhotographer.
from Ewing Galloway.
Meg ~~ 1OG5

709608f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue, east side, at Grove and Christopher Streets, showing the triangular park at the point of convergence of the last two mentioned thoroughfares. Grove Street is on the right of View 2 and faces Christopher
Street. The latter is on left of View 1.
May 12, 1940
P. L. Sperr  Views 1,2

720289f-a.text:
Grove Street, southerly side, east from Seventh Avenue South (right, not included), showing buildings thereupon, as viewed across the open triangular park at Christopher Street. In the center is the gap formed by the convergance of Washington Place and West 4th Street, and known as Sheridan Souare. The photographer details the restaurant-bar of Jack Delaney in View 2. This adjoins the corner of Seventh Avenue.
June 6, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
